snippet: Bill O’Brien, the team’s new football coach, is among the Nittany Lions coaches who are taking part in an 18-stop bus tour, which will come to Manhattan on Wednesday night.
lead_paragraph: Penn State Coach Bill O'Brien spent last week recruiting in cities like Philadelphia, Baltimore, Washington and Richmond, Va., traveling by bus to introduce himself to the large constituency he is now trying to win over: Nittany Lions football fans. O'Brien is headlining a group of Penn State coaches from various sports that is traveling in a caravan to meet with alumni and fans at 18 stops along the East Coast and in the Midwest. The nine-day bus tour is the latest step in O'Brien's delicate replacement of Joe Paterno, who was fired in November in the wake of a child sexual abuse scandal.

headline.main: Penn State Coaches Hit the Road to Meet Supporters
